de.rincewind.api.gui.components

Interface Modifyable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    WindowActivatable, WindowBrewing, WindowColorable, WindowEditor, WindowEnchanter, WindowFurnace, WindowPointer, WindowSizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftWindowActivatable, CraftWindowBrewing, CraftWindowColorable, CraftWindowEditor, CraftWindowEnchanter, CraftWindowFurnace, CraftWindowPointer, CraftWindowSizeable, TestWindow, TestWindow2, WindowConfirm, WindowFileBrowser, Windows.WindowActivatableExtendable, Windows.WindowBrewingExtendable, Windows.WindowColorableExtendable, Windows.WindowEditorExtendable, Windows.WindowEnchanterExtendable, Windows.WindowFurnaceExtendable, Windows.WindowPointerExtendable, Windows.WindowSizeableExtendable

    public interface Modifyable
    If a class implements this methods, you are able to add elements into that object. Each element-instance can only be added once. The size and/or the position are set in the element-instance. It is possible, that two element are on the same slot. The element, witch is added earlier is that one, that you can see. The methods take no care about, if the elements added to this object can be rendered or if the added elements are out of the shown area. The elements can decide, what item lays in there area. The area of an element is defined as rectangle limited with the elements size. There are tow special items: EMPTY_USED_SLOT INVISIBLE_ELEMENT
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    Rincewind34
    See Also:
    WindowEditor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack EMPTY_USED_SLOT
      If an element adds this item to the cache, this object will not replace the item with something else and the slot in the inventory remains empty.
      static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack INVISIBLE_ELEMENT
      If an element adds this item to the cache, this object know about, that there is the element present, but for example the WindowColorable will set the background color into this slot.

      Adds an element to this object.

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY_USED_SLOT

        static final org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack EMPTY_USED_SLOT
        If an element adds this item to the cache, this object will not replace the item with something else and the slot in the inventory remains empty.

      • INVISIBLE_ELEMENT

        static final org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack INVISIBLE_ELEMENT
        If an element adds this item to the cache, this object know about, that there is the element present, but for example the WindowColorable will set the background color into this slot.

    • Method Detail

      • getElements

        java.util.List<Element> getElements()
        Returns all added elements. If there is no element present, this method will return an empty list.
        Returns:
        all added elements.

      • getElementsAt

        java.util.List<Element> getElementsAt(Point point)
        Returns all elements laying on a specified point. Never mind, if the elements set position is equals to the specified point or if the element lays on this slot because of its size. If there is no element on this point, this method will return an empty list.
        Parameters:
        point - specified
        Returns:
        all elements laying on a specified point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the point is null.

      • getElementAt

        @Deprecated
Element getElementAt(Point point)
        Deprecated. because of the new method getVisibleElementAt(Point)
        Returns the first added element laying on a point never mind, if the element is visible or not. If there are no element laying on this point, this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        point - to check
        Returns:
        the first added element laying on a point
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the point is null

      • getVisibleElementAt

        Element getVisibleElementAt(Point point)
        Returns the first added visible element laying on a point. If there are no element laying on this point, this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        point - to get an element.
        Returns:
        the first added visible element laying on a point
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the point is null

      • elementCreator

        ElementCreator elementCreator()
        Returns the ElementCreator of this object.
        Returns:
        the ElementCreator of this object

      • readItemsFromAll

        void readItemsFromAll()
        Reads all set items from all elements into the cache. This method calls readItemsFrom(Element) to read the items.

      • readItemsFrom

        void readItemsFrom(Element element)
        Reads all set items from a specified element. The WindowEditor for example will add the new read items immediately into the bukkit-inventory.
        Parameters:
        element - to get the items from
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element is null

      • clearItemsFrom

        void clearItemsFrom(Element element)
        Removes all set items from an element out of the cache.
        Parameters:
        element - to get the items from
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element is null

      • addElement

        void addElement(Element element)
        Adds an element to this object. To create a new element use the ElementCreator (ModifyableelementCreator()). This method calls readItemsFrom(Element) to get the items to set from the new element.
        Parameters:
        element - to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element is null
        APIException - if the element is already added to a object

      • removeElement

        void removeElement(Element element)
        Removes an element from this object. This method calls clearItemsFrom(Element) to remove the items set from the old element.
        Parameters:
        element - to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element is null
        APIException - if the element is not added in this object.

      • priorize

        void priorize(Element element)
        Priorizes an element in this object. After invoking this method, this object handles the element as an element added before all other elements. To reconfigure the items in the cache this method calls clearItemsFrom(Element) and readItemsFromAll().
        Parameters:
        element - to priorize
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element is null
        APIException - if the element is not added in this object.

      • clearElements

        void clearElements()
        Removes all elements from this object using removeElement(Element) for all added elements.

      • hasVisibleElementAt

        boolean hasVisibleElementAt(Point point)
        Returns true if this object has a visible element at a specified point and false if not.
        Parameters:
        point - to check
        Returns:
        true if this object has a visible element at a specified point and false if not
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the point is null
